Mary Grace has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

Lucina has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lucina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

She has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her dress making.

With your help, Elisa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Jenelie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 26 years old and has three children who are currently in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Jenelie requested a PHP 26,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jenelie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ladelyn

texts.en:
Ladelyn is 55 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Ladelyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ladelyn has been raising pigs for eleven years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Melania

Melania is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melania requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Melania has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melania would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

Norma requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her basket weaving business.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Cecilia is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecilia has been farming vegetables for ten years and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Relyn

texts.en:
Relyn is 33 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Relyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Relyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soap, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Relyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julie

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Julie has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from poultry.

Julie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

To restart her business, Annabelle requested a 5,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.

Annabelle has been in this business for years now. With your help Annabelle will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc.

Elvie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for five years and earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elvie aspires to save money to expand her business.
